charge() Netscript Function

charge(worldX, worldY)
RAM cost

0.4 GB

Arguments

  • worldX (int()) – World X of the fragment to charge.

  • worldY (int()) – World Y of the fragment to charge.

Charge a fragment, increasing it’s power but also it’s heat. The effectiveness of the charge depends on the amount of ram the running script consumes as well as the fragments current heat. This operation takes time to complete.

Example:

Warning

Netscript JS users: This function is async
